title: ISic003367. I.Sicily inscription 003367

1 | τῶι Διὸς ἀγαθῶι Δ̣[---]-

38ΘΕΣΙΝ[..]ΓΓ[---]
39ΕΠΙΜ.[---]
[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Preliminary text based upon autopsy and photograph, with reference to editions of Manganaro and Gallavotti;
  • line.15: Manganaro 1981: ἦμ.ς ἐν ψ[- (it appears Manganaro could read the first part of the line, but nothing is now visible).
  • line.26: Manganaro 1981: χρησμ[ὸς], but there is no trace after the sigma
  • line.27: Manganaro 1981: φανείσ.[, but there is no trace after the sigma
  • line.28: Manganaro 1981: Παμφυλ[ία], but there is no trace after the upsilon
  • line.34: Manganaro 1981: γα(ν) δαιων [-, but the stone is clear, as Gallavotti 1983

translation

commentary

The stone was first published by Manganaro 1981 in association with ISic002754, the two seemingly having been discovered together, or at least in close proximity; the letter forms are essentially identical, and the texts were probably cut by the same hand. Manganaro 1981 and Parke 1986 noted the further potential relevance of ISic001040.
